commits.author: Harry Pidcock
commits.message: Go mod

commits.author: Juju bot
commits.message:
Merge pull request #4 from jameinel/intern-buf-offset

https://github.com/juju/lru/pull/4

This changes the LRU implementations from using pointers and list.List entries to using offsets into a buffer.

The big wins here are in total memory consumption and memory fragmentation. Benchmarks show that it is a fair bit faster, and a lot less memory churn. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dKU65ctSM7wll5BABmK6RNhyiPRDdqFg5ofjiJLYBoE/edit?usp=sharing

I created a script that used the various LRU implementations to cache “Count” 8-byte keys, and then asked go runtime to tell me things like how long it took and how much memory was being consumed. There were 2 main tests:

  1. Inserting 1M,2M,5M,10M keys into a cache with 1M slots. This tests just insert performance when things are being excised as fast as they are being inserted. It also tests total memory consumption.
  2. Creating a cache of size 1/2/5/10M and then inserting twice as many keys. This tests how memory scales when you have a larger cache.

Some interesting datapoints from the benchmarking

  • Prealloc has a larger effect across the board than I expected. I had thought that things like inserting 10x the keys into a 1M buffer would result in the time not mattering (the buffer fills after the first 1M keys, and from then on the rest of the inserts don’t reallocate memory). It is plausible that this is just the initial offset, as the slow doesn’t seem dramatically affected. (it adds about 300ms to not prealloc but the test itself finishes in about 900ms worst case).

  • TotalAlloc of Intern (old and new) and the new LRU are way better than previous, and better than Hashicorps implementation. At small numbers, Hashicorp never reallocs, so 1M into 1M cache looks better. But Juju doesn’t allocate on every Add() which scales much better.

  • Final HeapInUse is a bit noisy, I think this is dependent on how we trigger GC, as it seems surprising that 5M keys into a 1M cache, would use more memory than 10M keys into a 1M cache. The big win for HeapInUse is Prealloc, and the new LRU implementation that uses a fixed buffer, instead of a list.List and a map to *list.Element. “master lru” had better time performance on large number of keys, because it avoided one of the dereference operations (simplelru points at a list.Element, and then has to get to list.Element.Values.value.) Also the extra alloc for every new Add() having to create an ‘element’ struct to put in the Values interface. However, master lru used quite a bit more memory, because its ‘complex’ struct was saved in the map, which means that the empty slots the map preallocates were large, rather than just a simple pointer. The new implementation uses a uint32 and then the large structs are just stored in a compact array.

  • For the use case of caching strings, Intern dominates all the LRU implementations (memory, speed, etc). Probably because it doesn’t indirect via interface{}? And it certainly can have fewer pointers overall (doesn’t need a key pointer, etc.)

  • The fixed size buffer is both faster and consumes less memory, which is nice. I had been worried that updating the linked list would be faster with pointers, but I suppose if you have to page in a different set of memory, it is the same cost, and this way the memory is more compact, so there is less overall paging.

  • Prealloc is so much faster, I might just make it the standard behavior and remove dynamic memory allocation. If you size the cache correctly, it will all be in use anyway.

  • The new code does allocate more total memory if you don’t prealloc, then the old code did for Intern. This may be a case of ‘realloc()’ needing more memory for a brief period of time, and golang maps being more efficient at growing organically. But with prealloc, we improve that dramatically.

When trying to bind to addresses other then localhost macos prompts the user to accept the firewall hole. For tests this becomes very annoying and slows down iteration.

  • Forces Mongo to bind to localhost. This was already happening but it’s an explicit change now.
  • When hunting for a free port number use localhost as not to create the firewall dialogue.

commits.author: Juju bot
commits.message:
Merge pull request #24 from hpidcock/fix-read-concern

https://github.com/juju/mgo/pull/24

For safety, we need to set the readConcern and writeConcern in transactions and ensure readPreference is on the primary.

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Expose PruneTxns in order to allow external tools to use it by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/16
  • Add progress logging while pruning transactions by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/17
  • Retry errors that finish with ‘unexpected message’. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • Add export_test.go by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/19
  • Use mgo.Collection.Bulk to prune docs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/20
  • Add RunTransaction observer by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/21
  • Use disk-based pruning strategy by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/22
  • Make prune log output consistent by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/23
  • Cleanup txn.Stash as part of regular pruning by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • Cleanup all collections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/25
  • Don’t create transactions that have no operations. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/27
  • Abstract out “Completed Transaction” functionality by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/26
  • Properly test no-op does the right thing, as does real errors. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/28
  • Add a command-line utility to clean and purge txns. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • Add logging information about the pruning result. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/29
  • Turns out it isn’t safe to use aggregation in 2.4 at all. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/31
  • support using RemoveAll($in) instead of Bulk. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/32
  • Various cleanups by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/35
  • track what is actually removed by Oracle.RemoveTxns() by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/34
  • Expose a NewestTime for PruneOptions. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/36
  • Handle Bulk.Run() result being nil by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/37
  • When observing transactions include the run Duration. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/40
  • Change Clock back to being optional. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/41
  • Allow passing in a parameter to limit the number of transactions evaluated by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/42
  • Expose the batch size and number of batches. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/43
  • No need for uint64 and it makes default printing ugly by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/44
  • Use juju/clock package for the clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/45
  • Incremental prune by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/46
  • 2.4 prune options by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/47
  • Pass the transaction attempt by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • Revert “Merge pull request #48 from SimonRichardson/txn-attempt” by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/51
  • Add testing.SetFailIfTransaction. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/49
  • Retry i/o timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/52
  • Thread through the transaction by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/50
  • juju/txn with server side transactions by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/55
  • Add help text to explain why hooks do not run by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • Properly handle when RemoveAll returns an error. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/57
  • Use github.com/juju/mgo/v2 and convert to go mod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/58
  • Add extra txn backoff tuning parameters for sstxn by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/59
  • Make retry fuzz a percent and use durations instead of floats by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/60
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/61
  • Add support for no change log, used when upgrading to SSTXN. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • @jameinel made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • @cmars made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/txn/commits/v2.0.0

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • httptesting: fix for Go 1.6 by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/93
  • testing: remove deprecated AddSuiteCleanup function by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/94
  • add PatchExecHelper and CaptureOutput helpers by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/95
  • Fix PatchExecHelper.GetExecCommand on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/96
  • Handle the error return from utils.SetHome(). by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/97
  • testing: add TCPProxy.CloseConns by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/98
  • mgo: don’t panic while resetting admin password by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/99
  • Don’t drop and recreate the database between tests by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • testing: don’t panic during TearDownTest if SetUpTest failed by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/101

  • Detect mongod version before starting test server by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/104

  • Update to use the latest loggo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/107
  • Retry mgo dial if unexpected message. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/109
  • Hook up mgo logging and reconnect properly. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/110
  • add NewProxiedSession by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/111
  • implement Clock.NewTimer by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/108
  • Bump mongo error output to 100 lines by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • Update testing.Clock to improve robustness by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/113
  • NewProxiedSession - ping to assign a socket to the returned session. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • checkers: ignore time zone in DeepEqual by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/115
  • MongoDB needs –key=value not –key value now by @dooferlad in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/116
  • Fixes for replicaset by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • Introduces a type which can be used to mock calls by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/118
  • tcpproxy: add pause and resume to the stream by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/119
  • Disable mgo logging/debugging by default by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/120
  • Mongo 3.4 uses a different string to indicate it is ready for connections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/121
  • Fix EchoQuotedArgsUnix/AssertEchoArgs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/122
  • Fix PatchExecutableAsEchoArgs on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/124
  • Prefer mongod 3.2 and improve mongod info caching by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123

releases.title: v1.0.0

  • wireformat/budget: export baseURL to help with testing by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/22

  • Sorted allocations. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/32
  • plan/api: Export url to help ftests by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/31
  • api/terms: Export BaseURL to make testing easier by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/33
  • 20160418 juju deps by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/36
  • Update juju dependencies. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/34
  • Resolving model name in show-budget. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/35
  • cmd/listplans: Return a more appropriate type to help with testing by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/37
  • setplan: Fixed the output of set plan, argument order was reversed in error message by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/39

  • Account for service to application changes in juju-core by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/44
  • Update dependencies to juju w/ service-to-application landed. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/47
  • cmd/allocate: Improvement on error message to make order of args obvious by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/41
  • Make juju list- aliases for their juju by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/45
  • Changes the “less” prompt to remind user to press q to exit. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/46
  • Update command help text for romulus commands by @cherylj in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/48
  • JUJU_TERMS environment variable for base terms service url. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/50
  • Update to new juju modelcmd API. by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/55
  • cmd/agree: Updated agree command to support terms that have owners by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/51
  • Using charm.v6 ParseTerm method in the agree command. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/56
  • Update to the latest version of charm.v6-unstable. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/57
  • api/terms: Removed terms api (now lives in juju/terms-client) by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/58
  • Update juju, gnuflag deps, jujuclienttesting.MemStore tests use user-qualified model names. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/60
  • Move the commands to core juju repo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/61
  • UserStatusResponse structure by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/62
  • Added sla credentials to the wireformat. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/64
  • sla: Added packages that implement the support api by @mattyw in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/63
  • Add model meter status. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/66
  • budget svc refactor changes by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/65
  • Decode service response errors in sla api. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/67
  • Support indicating default budget in list budgets response. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/68
  • Add owner to SLA response wireformat. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/69
  • Handle unack’able batches. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/70
  • s/budget/wallet/; s/allocate|allocation/budget/; by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/71
  • Added a message field to the sla response. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/73
  • Added wallet parameter to update budget requests. by @tasdomas in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/74
  • Add labels to metrics. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/75
  • Added model name to the metric batch type. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/77
  • Update to macaroon/macaroon-bakery v2-unstable by @Veebers in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/76
  • Configurable API root for clients. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/78
  • Update to use macaroon.v2 and bakery.v2 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/80
  • Convert to go mod and use macaroon-bakery v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/81
  • Use gopkg.in/macaroon-bakery.v3 instead of github.com/go-macaroon-bakery/macaroon-bakery/v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/82
  • Use latest bakery v3 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/83
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/84

New Contributors

  • @macgreagoir made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/45
  • @cherylj made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/48
  • @rogpeppe made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/romulus/pull/55

releases.title: 2.8.0: Unit.reboot, RelationMeta.optional, and type-checked tests
releases.body:
This release includes a few small improvements: a new function Unit.reboot() (for machine charms only), the “optional” attribute of relations in metadata.yaml is now available in the RelationMeta object, and if the Pebble socket is missing (for example, if the container has just rebooted) we provide a clearer exception:

  • feat: add Unit.reboot for machine charms in #1041
  • feat: add RelationMeta.optional in #1038
  • feat: provide a clearer exception when the Pebble socket is missing in #1049

We fixed a couple of small issues:

  • fix: push_path and pull_path include empty directories in #1024
  • fix: reset collected statuses in Harness.evaluate_status in #1048

We’ve also made a few small improvements to the documentation:

  • docs: note that status changes are immediate in #1029
  • docs: add note to ActionEvent.set_results about maximum size in #1047
  • docs: document more of the exceptions that may be raised in #1044
  • docs: make pebble.Client.remove_path and Container.remove_path docs consistent in #1031
  • docs: update the PyPI development status to production/stable in #1020

Finally, we wrapped up our work on #1007, so the test suite is now fully type checked, did a couple of other minor type hinting improvements, and broke out the ‘real’ Pebble tests into a separate file for more clarity (you can still just run tox -e pebble):

  • test: add type hints to test_testing in #1017
  • test: add type hints to test_model in #1015
  • test: add type hints to test_charm in #1022
  • test: add type hints to test_storage in #1023
  • test: add type hints to test_framework in #1025
  • test: add type hints to test_main in #1028
  • test: add type hints to pebble-related tests in #1030
  • test: separate the real pebble tests into a separate module in #1018
  • chore: remove as much ‘if typing.TYPE_CHECKING:’ as possible in #1034
  • feat: narrow the type for ‘app’ and ‘unit’ in relation events by in #1032

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.7.0…2.8.0

releases.title: 2.7.0: Unit.set_ports(), and minor docs, CI, and test improvements
releases.body:
This release includes one new feature, a new function Unit.set_ports() to declare which ports should be open. We recommend using this method rather than managing multiple Unit.open_port() and Unit.close_port() calls:

  • feat: add Unit.set_ports() for declarative port opening #1005

We’ve also made a few small improvements to the documentation:

  • docs: reduce the amount of detail in the open/close port methods in #1006
  • docs: remove ‘you’ and ‘your’ from docstrings in #1003
  • docs: minor cleanup of the HACKING doc in #1016

Finally, we’ve also made a start expanding our type hinting to cover the test suite, and made a couple of minor improvements/fixes to our CI:

  • test: add type hints to the test_infra tests in #1008
  • test: add type hints to test_log tests by in #1009
  • test: fix type hinting on test_jujuversion tests in #1011
  • test: fix type hint warnings in test_private tests in #1012
  • test: add type hinting to test_lib by in #1012
  • test: add type hinting to test_helpers in #1014
  • ci: use Go 1.20 for real Pebble tests in #1004
  • ci: re-enable integration tests with mysql-*operator by in #1013

(Thanks @tonyandrewmeyer for your first contributions, and welcome to the team!)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/2.6.0…2.7.0

releases.title: 2.6.0: Harness.handle_exec, Harness.add_relation improvements, and more
releases.body:
This release has two significant improvements to testing.Harness:

  • Add Harness.handle_exec to allow charm tests to simulate Container.exec calls (Pebble one-shot commands) and provide expected output. Thanks @weiiwang01 for the design and implementation (PR 993).
  • Simplify adding relation units and relation data by adding app_data and unit_data parameters to Harness.add_relation. Previously, charm tests would have to call add_relation followed by add_relation_unit and update_relation_data – now only a single add_relation call is required. Implemented in PR 994.

In addition, several small improvements and fixes are included:

  • feat(model): add Secret.unique_identifier (XID part); improve id/label docs in #986
  • fix(testing): ignore push() encoding if source is a binary file or stream in #991
  • fix(pebble): remove use of deprecated cgi module in Pebble code in #996
  • fix(model): ensure Secret.get_content returns a copy of the dict in #1000
  • fix(model): make Secret.set_content invalidate local cache by in #1001

See all changes from 2.5.0 to 2.6.0.

commits.author: Tony Meyer
commits.message: Add badges for workflows. (#112)

commits.author: Angelos Kolaitis
commits.message:
Increase default SnapClient timeout to 30 seconds (#111)

  • Increase default SnapClient timeout to 30 seconds

SnapClient has a default timeout of 5 seconds for all RPCs to the snapd socket. If any operation takes more, an exception is raised to the caller.

We have seen this causing issues in slow CI environments, where a simple config-changed hook will attempt to check if a snap is installed, timeout and move the unit to a blocked status (causing the CI run to fail). This is augmented by the fact that typically SnapCache is used instead of SnapClient, which only uses the default value and does not provide a way to configure the timeout.

Simply increasing the timeout is enough to tackle the flakes.

  • Bump LIBPATCH to 3

commits.author: Robert Gildein
commits.message:
Add functional tests for grub lib (#104)

Switch to use update_config instead of save_config in Config.update function to ensure charm configs are updated and not overwritten. Fix wiring lines in _save_config function. Raise ApplyError if grub-mkconfig command failed, since it is failing also if there is wrong validation.

Since the grub lib required to run integration tests on machine or VM, we are switch to running integration tests directly on GitHub runner. It was not possible to run it on VMs, since the GitHub runner do not supports nested virtualization.

releases.title: v1.5.0: Pebble Notices core, API, client; Requester interface and ErrorResponse
releases.body:
New features

  • Add Pebble notices core state handling, API, and Go client
  • Add ErrorResponse to allow external error creation
  • Expose Requester interface to allow derived projects to use the Pebble-instantiated client and extend the available commands

Other minor changes

  • fix(daemon): add-notice API shouldn’t error if no data is provided in #321
  • fix(state): set noticeCond correctly in ReadState in #320
  • fix(snap): make snapcraft.yaml compatible with remote-builds in #322

New Contributors

  • @olivercalder made their first contribution in #320

releases.title: v1.4.0: health subcommand, Loki log forwarding client
releases.body:
This release includes two new features:

  • The new pebble health subcommand, implemented by @rebornplusplus in #299.
  • Log forwarding to Loki, implemented by @barrettj12 in #267.

In addition, we improved the error message from exec when the $HOME directory doesn’t exist, and other minor changes.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/pebble/compare/v1.3.0…v1.4.0

releases.title: v1.3.0: Service context, exec fixes, WaitDelay fix, and more
releases.body:
This is Pebble version v1.3.0. It includes several notable features and fixes since v1.2.0, as well as many CI and testing improvements, and a significant refactoring of the Pebble internals.

What’s Changed

Notable user-facing features and fixes:

  • fix: pebble exec and “exec” health checks inherit environment from daemon by @rebornplusplus in #234
  • fix: allow non-root user to specify current user/group when running commands by @benhoyt in #239
  • feat: add support for services to configure working directory by @benhoyt in #245
  • feat: add “service context” support for exec and health checks by @benhoyt in #246
  • fix: do not inherit HOME and USER env vars from pebble daemon environment by @shayancanonical in #262
  • fix(servstate): use WaitDelay to avoid Command.Wait blocking on stdin/out/err by @benhoyt in #275
  • feat(logstate): log forwarding implementation II by @barrettj12 in #256

Refactoring and CI improvements:

  • refactor: Pebble internals into an exportable package by @anpep in #226
  • ci: allow Pebble to be packaged as a snap by @cjdcordeiro in #179
  • ci: promote snap to candidate on every release by @cjdcordeiro in #255
  • cli: public commands API by @anpep in #232
  • build: update Go version to 1.20 by @barrettj12 in #171
  • ci: build Pebble snap with Go 1.20 by @cjdcordeiro in #271
  • feat(daemon): allowing adding external http handlers by @paul-rodriguez in #265
  • feat(overlord): allow adding external managers by @paul-rodriguez in #273
  • feat(cli): enable extended client access by @anpep in #285
  • feat(daemon): daemon access for API extensions by @flotter in #293

New Contributors

  • @sparkiegeek made their first contribution in #227
  • @cjdcordeiro made their first contribution in #179
  • @paul-rodriguez made their first contribution in #265
  • @shayancanonical made their first contribution in #262

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/pebble/compare/v1.2.0…v1.3.0

The changes in dskit, apart from the migration (https://github.com/grafana/dskit/pull/356), are:

  • https://github.com/grafana/dskit/pull/347
  • https://github.com/grafana/dskit/pull/349, which required small changes in pkg/canary/reader/reader.go and pkg/canary/writer/push.go
  • https://github.com/grafana/dskit/pull/352
  • https://github.com/grafana/dskit/pull/354

Which issue(s) this PR fixes:

(none)

Special notes for your reviewer:

Checklist - [x] Reviewed the CONTRIBUTING.md guide (required) - [n/a] Documentation added - [n/a] Tests updated - [n/a] CHANGELOG.md updated - [n/a] If the change is worth mentioning in the release notes, add add-to-release-notes label - [n/a] Changes that require user attention or interaction to upgrade are documented in docs/sources/setup/upgrade/_index.md - [n/a] For Helm chart changes bump the Helm chart version in production/helm/loki/Chart.yaml and update production/helm/loki/CHANGELOG.md and production/helm/loki/README.md. commits.author: Benjamin Schimke
commits.message:
Make logdump action output path configurable (#111)

Currently, the logdump action output path is hard-coded. Running this action twice in the same CI causes these actions to overwrite each others logs.

With this commit, the path can now be configured by setting the $LOGDUMP_OUTPUT_DIR env variable in a workflow. If it is not set the path will fall-back to tmp_logs_$GITHUB_JOB with $GITHUB_JOB being the unique id of the current running job.

Closes #95

commits.author: Daniela Plascencia
commits.message:
build: pin jsonschema to >4, <4.18 to avoid installing 4.18.x (#49)

  • build: pin jsonschema to >4, <4.18 to avoid installing 4.18.x

Because some dependencies of jsonschema now require the rust toolchain (see 1 and 2), building charms that depend on SDI (and therefore pull jsonschema) fail when building because none of them have rustc available when pip installing the charm’s python dependencies.

Reasoning: jsonschema 4.18.x introduced a dependency on rdps-py which at the same time introduced a dependency on maturin, a python package that requires the rustc toolchain to be built and installed from source. jsonschema <4.18 does not have that dependency.

Links: [1]python-jsonschema/jsonschema#1117 [2] python-jsonschema/jsonschema#1114

Partially fixes: canonical/bundle-kubeflow#648

Co-authored-by: Adam Dyess adam.dyess@canonical.com Co-authored-by: Andrew Scribner ca.scribner+1@gmail.com

commits.author: Daniela Plascencia
commits.message:
build, fix: upgrade mypy version and fix lint errors (#50)

releases.title: installer-v2.3.4
releases.body: microk8s version: 1.28 kubectl version: 1.28.3 multipass version: 1.12.2 installer version: 2.3.4

releases.title: MicroK8s v1.28 released!
releases.body:
Featured in this release

Dual stack support and CIDR configuration made easy

In the past, community members provided instructions on how to configure dual-stack in MicroK8s clusters. From this release onwards, dual-stack along with the respective CIDR configuration can be easily setup with launch configurations even at install time.

You can read more on dual stack over at: - https://microk8s.io/docs/explain-dual-stack - https://microk8s.io/docs/how-to-dual-stack

Improve security and CIS compliance

Full CIS compliance can be achieved with a single call: microk8s enable cis-hardening. For auditors and those interested in what each CIS recommendation is about we have assembled a detailed list of each recommendation and how we comply with it. Some of the CIS hardening suggestions have been adopted as default setup options in MicroK8s, for example the authentication of users is now done via x509 certificates instead of tokens.

For the work on this feature you can read: - https://microk8s.io/docs/cis-compliance - https://microk8s.io/docs/how-to-cis-harden

Ceph and MicroK8s

Try this microk8s enable rook-ceph to get the Rook Ceph operator on your cluster. We found that pairing MicroCeph, the low ops Ceph distribution, with MicroK8s produces a great setup in terms of feature richenss, stability and effectiveness. In our docs we have a guide showing how to testdirve this combination on a single node cluster.

Read more at: - https://microk8s.io/docs/how-to-ceph - https://canonical-microceph.readthedocs-hosted.com/en/latest/ - https://rook.io/

New partner joining our addons ecosystem

Two addons joined our ecosystems:

  • KubeArmor is a cloud-native runtime security enforcement system that restricts the behavior (such as process execution, file access, and networking operations) of pods, containers, and nodes at the system level.

  • MICROCKS is a CNCF project designed to simplify and streamline API mocking and testing, with support for many different types of API and integrations for GitHub, Gitlab, Jenkins and more.

Detail list of updates since last release

Kubernetes core services

  • Kubernetes v1.28

  • Calico CNI updated to v3.25.1

    Usability Improvements

  • microk8s status will return an error code in case the cluster is not yet ready.

  • microk8s join no longer fails if nodes cannot resolve each others hostnames. This limitation has been lifted by updating the default arguments of kube-apiserver.

  • fixes iptables rule with custom CIDR, thanks @Dunge

  • Certificate based authentication replaces token auth

  • kubelet certificate authority set to the cluster CA by default

  • RBAC rules for kubelet webhook auth-mode loaded by default

  • EventRateLimit is enabled by default

  • Kubelet now does not serialize image pulls by default, which should result in faster image pulls (thanks @ghboutry)

  • Attempt to increase inotify and async IO limits if found too low

    Addon updates

  • New addon: kubearmor, thanks to @nyrahul and @webdevgopi

  • New addon: microcks, thank you @yada

  • Update ArgoCD to v2.7.2 and add support for ARM64, thank you @alirezaghey

  • Coredns updated to v1.10.1

  • cilium updated to 1.13.4 now supporting multi-node clusters

  • gopapdle updated to v4.2.9, added support for ARM64, renamed to goppadle from goppadle-lite, thank you @Gayathri-Bluemeric

  • Metrics server updated to v0.6.3

  • Ingress updated to v1.8.0

  • linkerd updated to v2.13.5, thank you @balchua

  • keda updated to v2.11.1, thank you @balchua

  • kata addon expects to find a runtime and does not use the kata-runtime snap anymore

  • trivy addon updated tov 0.15.1

  • Metallb updated to v0.13.10, thank you @jadams

  • Istio updated to v1.18.2, thank you @aalonsolopez

Move Dqlite bind address logic into utils (#51)

This cleans up the API code by moving implementation details into a separate function.

commits.author: Benjamin Schimke
commits.message:
Check if Calico canReachHost parameter is valid (#50)

The canReachHost represents a string representation of an IP. In the current implementation it is not guaranteed that the passed parameter is actually a valid IP address and would automatically classify it as IPv6.

The function will now check if the IP is valid and return an appropiate error message if not.

commits.message: linting

commits.author: Daniela Plascencia
commits.message:
build: pin jsonschema to >4, <4.18 to avoid installing 4.18.x (#49)

  • build: pin jsonschema to >4, <4.18 to avoid installing 4.18.x

Because some dependencies of jsonschema now require the rust toolchain (see 1 and 2), building charms that depend on SDI (and therefore pull jsonschema) fail when building because none of them have rustc available when pip installing the charm’s python dependencies.

Reasoning: jsonschema 4.18.x introduced a dependency on rdps-py which at the same time introduced a dependency on maturin, a python package that requires the rustc toolchain to be built and installed from source. jsonschema <4.18 does not have that dependency.

Links: [1]python-jsonschema/jsonschema#1117 [2] python-jsonschema/jsonschema#1114

Partially fixes: canonical/bundle-kubeflow#648

Co-authored-by: Adam Dyess adam.dyess@canonical.com Co-authored-by: Andrew Scribner ca.scribner+1@gmail.com

  • Added extensions support in the certificate generation by @Mehdi-Bendriss in #16
  • Adds a charmhub promote job to CI by @gruyaume in #17

  • Revoke all issued certificates on config_changed by @ghislainbourgeois in #18

  • Add action to generate certificates by @hemanthnakkina in #20
  • Fix charm build by @ghislainbourgeois in #22
  • Publish only tested charm by @ghislainbourgeois in #24
  • Install charmcraft before using it by @ghislainbourgeois in #25
  • Use sudo for snap install by @ghislainbourgeois in #26
  • Move downloaded artifact charm where charmcraft can find it by @ghislainbourgeois in #27
  • [ISSUE-29] Upgrading to 22.04 jammy by @deusebio in #30
  • chore: drop noisy update_status warnings to debug by @marcoppenheimer in #32
  • Revert Merge pull request #32 by @gruyaume in #33
  • Archive logs on integration tests failure by @ghislainbourgeois in #36

  • Add ca-certificate-validity config option by @deusebio in #38
  • Uses upload-charm workflow to upload charm by @gruyaume in #39
  • Standardises around charmcraft token environment variable by @gruyaume in #40
  • [Feat] Uses tls-certificates-interface lib v2.1 by @gruyaume in #42
  • Adds requirer charm to the integration tests by @saltiyazan in #43

  • Adds charm deployment command in README by @saltiyazan in #53

  • Add CSR validation by @patriciareinoso in #67

commits.author: Mia Altieri
commits.message:
disable all startup services (#37)

It doesn’t make sense for any of the daemons in charmed-mongodb snap to start up automatically in the snap. They require specific configurations and an up and a running mongos instance. We can keep them enabled, but they will show an error state:

ubuntu@ip-172-31-37-213:~$ sudo snap logs charmed-mongodb.pbm-agent
2023-09-16T14:25:39Z systemd[1]: Started Service for snap application charmed-mongodb.pbm-agent.
2023-09-16T14:25:39Z charmed-mongodb.pbm-agent[4119638]: 2023/09/16 14:25:39 Error: Parse command line parameters: required flag --mongodb-uri not provided
2023-09-16T14:25:39Z systemd[1]: snap.charmed-mongodb.pbm-agent.service: Deactivated successfully.

commits.author: shayancanonical
commits.message:
Add mysqlrouter exporter snap daemon and upgrade to 8.0.35 (#41)

  • Upgrade to 8.0.35 and add snap daemon for mysqlrouter exporter

  • Avoid assumption that snap daemons inherit env vars

  • Relay env vars into the exec command when running as snap daemon

  • Always skip tls cert verification for router exporter in snaps

  • Run apt-get clean before checking version mismatch in CI

  • Add mysqlrouter-exporter as exception to the smoke test

  • Run apt-cache policy temp lxc container for version mismatch check

  • Run lxd init in version mismatch check

  • Use sg to run lxc commands

  • Use sudo to run apt-get update in temp lxd container

  • Add sleep to ensure the temp lxd container is launched

  • Remove experimental lxc-wait command

  • Add tmate session

  • Change tmate session to run on pull request

  • Remove tmate session and run apt-get update before getting apt version

commits.author: phvalguima
commits.message:
[DPE-1464] Sync folder layout with OpenSearch DEB package

Changes the folder structure to a format similar to DEB package, with: * \({SNAP_DATA}/etc/opensearch: folder structure for configuration files * \){SNAP_DATA}/usr/share/opensearch: folder for the binaries: scripts, java packages, plugins, modules, etc * \({SNAP_COMMON}/var/lib/opensearch: folder to hold the actual user data * \){SNAP_COMMON}/var/log/opensearch: logging folder

At installation, updates the default opensearch.yml to use the new folder structure by default.

Implements DPE-2350 and extends the testing workflow to cover the following scenarios: * Installation / removal of the backup plugin * Add / remove keys from keystore * Upgrade test

releases.title: v0.8.0
releases.body:
We’re proud to announce the first versioned release of Chisel!

Work has been ongoing for the last few months, and this release represents the first of many upcoming releases.

Chisel is a software tool for carving and cutting Debian packages!

It is built on the idea of package slices - minimal, complimentary and loosely coupled sets of files, based on the packages metadata and content. Slices are basically subsets of the Debian packages, with their own content and set of dependencies to other internal and external slices.

To install the latest version of Chisel, run the following command:

go install github.com/canonical/chisel/cmd/chisel@v0.8.0

Chisel is invoked using chisel . To get more information:

To see a help summary, type chisel -h. To see a short description of all commands, type chisel help --all. To see details for one command, type chisel help <command> or chisel <command> -h.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/chisel/commits/v0.8.0

releases.title: v0.7.0
releases.body:
Added

  • Support for defining a contents index in the index.md file.
  • Support for hidden items on the contentx index.
  • Support for external items on the contents index
  • Automatically moving the discourse-gatekeeper/content tag when the documentation is up to date with discourse

Fixed

  • Navigation table not getting removed if the contents was hidden using the [details=...]...[/details] tag.
  • No longer use empty values from INPUT_COMMIT_SHA instead of reading the event/ environment
  • Removing leading and trailing whitespace in base content for comparison
  • Correct failing pre-flight checks due to shallowly checked out repos

releases.title: v0.6.0 - Protecting Community Contributions
releases.body:
Added

  • Raising PRs with community contributions on discourse
  • Signing commits if required by a repository

Changed

  • Conflict detection logic no longer uses git to merge for page conflicts. Instead any differences between discourse and the feature branch on a specific page lead to a failed run.

Fixed

  • Improved logging of conflicts

releases.title: v0.5.0 Remove base_branch Input
releases.body:
Changed

  • Removed base_branch input.

Fixed

  • Add support for handling tags that are directly linked to a commit which resulted in a failure before.

commits.author: Mariyan Dimitrov

fix(starter): Rename JSON metadata files (#4)

The JSON metadata files require an .properties.json extension, so this commit renames the .json files to .properties.json.

In addition, I’ve moved the icons from a dedicated icons/ folder in the workflow-templates/ folder, as they need to be present here according to the doc at https://docs.github.com/en/actions/using-workflows/creating-starter-workflows-for-your-organization

commits.author: Ashley James
commits.message:
fix(redfish): Make redfish storage name in URI dynamic. (#49)

  • fix(redfish): Make redfish storage name in URI dynamic.

The redfish storage name in the URI was initially hardcoded to “Storage”. On some servers which did not conform to the schema specification, this name was provided differently, eg: Storages.

This change aims to find the storage uri name dynamically while fetching the storage controller and storage drive data.

Also: * Add new unit test + fix old ones. * Remove unit test number prefixes. * Remove unnecessary assertions from unit tests.

Fixes canonical/hardware-observer-operator#91, canonical/hardware-observer-operator#108

commits.author: Raul Benencia
commits.message:
Disable setuptools package automatic discovery

setuptools-61.0.0 introduced automatic discovery for packages if no packages or py_modules is explicitly specified. Package autodiscovery causes Debian builds to fail with:

error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout: [‘snap’, ‘debian’].

More information about this bug can be found in:

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=1021925

This can be fixed by disabling package autodiscovery, as I believe that this software does not rely on that feature. More information in:

  • https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/history.html#v61-0-0
  • https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3227
  • https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3227#issuecomment-1081688343
